urls.title: Get a personal wellbeing report free via your smart phone | Canal & River Trust
urls.description: Do you feel happier when you‚Äôre in green space? Does listening to birdsong lift your spirits? We‚Äôre launching our largest ever citizen science project to record the benefits of being beside water, and we‚Äôd like you to join in as well.

tweets.text: @HMofBray @RomneyWeir @EnvAgencySE I doubt that boat is registered on the river so will be hard to prosecute or seize the vessel if it‚Äôs not moored on the river. It looks like a typical eBay purchase that will have no doubt have launched from the public leisure centre slipway at Windsor.

tweets.text: Great to see frogspawn where we have worked hard clearing willow self seeds from encroaching some of our ponds. We have also been clearing self seeds from some the islands at the Kersal wetlands & put on some straw bales to encourage nesting wildfowl & waders @EnvAgencyNW https://t.co/v9GgzhgC6K

@StinkStopthe Walleys Quarry-This must be the largest landfill incident @EnvAgency has ever dealt with.I was told @PHE_uk have been informed.But we have no advice?The smell is causing headaches/ nausea / sore throats for many locally. @NewsNBC @AaronBell4NUL how is health risk being assessed?

It‚Äôs official, our new fishing licences will be released tomorrow! üêü

Buy yours from 1 March at: https://t.co/gUzhQTY4NQ https://t.co/uzFTMFoDIX
My wife and children have had to leave the house this morning and go up to a relative out of the area. This isn't fair, why is nobody helping us?

@MaryDuffinator @EnvAgencySE @Sara_Conway3 @BarnetCouncil @CRTSouthEast Hang on a minute, Mary. If I complained to you about a tree in your neighbour‚Äôs garden shedding leaves onto the street, you‚Äôd say: ‚ÄùActually, that‚Äôs not my land. Talk to next door.‚Äù Wouldn‚Äôt you? What‚Äôs the difference?! #welshharp

Where there‚Äôs a will there‚Äôs a way! Pictures of cleanup work at an area a bit downstream from the Silk Bridge(A5)where the #Silkstream enters the Welsh Harp! Let‚Äôs #cleantheharp and make the Trash Screens/traps work properly to prevent this built up of litter again! @EnvAgencySE https://t.co/ExXGf7losH

#WalleysQuarry @RedIndustries2 landfill on Silverdale Road is making the lives of residents in @NewsNBC utterly miserable. In addition to the persistent, widespread, disgusting smell, people are reporting impact on their health. @EnvAgency @AaronBell4NUL please take action NOW! https://t.co/dBe4OsizNl

Suez, who operate the Campground Waste and Recycling Centre, have given an update on the fire which started today. Our site controller will be back there tomorrow to monitor air quality and water runoff https://t.co/Ix2IXgw6L7
ü§Æü§Æü§Æü§¨not a single river in Green ü§¢and now what I consider to be the finest Chalkstream in Norfolk the River Babingley  in Red ü§¨ https://t.co/AWdyW1yQxj https://t.co/u2C1buO6r7

Our crews are working hard with partners to resolve the incident in Springwell. We‚Äôll be working throughout the night to extinguish the fire.  If you live in the area, please keep windows closed due to the smoke. Thank you @salvationarmyuk for your support to all at the incident https://t.co/BaqpOgMznV

tweets.text: The same trash screens that @EnvAgencySE said yesterday they clean regularly. The system is not working, please fix it üôè Note the Giant Hogweed on the rise @CRTSouthEast @BarnetCouncil https://t.co/9EFhn6fLY2

@CharlesJardine @srbuss @wwf_uk Updated version below, uses the latest set of data from @Defra.

Hope all's well. https://t.co/9CBU1azo4c

The @EnvAgency need to understand that groundwater ingress is an un-permitted reason to discharge untreated sewage. We hope the local residents impacted by these discharges are compensated for having to live with these daily events, has happened continuously since the 22nd Jan.

The community the live near Bois Mill on the @RiverChess tell us not only highly discoloured but smell was terrible, the worst they remember. The @EnvAgency need to note this has nothing to do with storm events, no rain yesterday, this is entirely due to groundwater ingress. https://t.co/zPThbWUdBw

Keeping our Welsh Harp clean is a responsibility we all share. We are so grateful to our volunteers who contribute every day to reduce the high level of waste generated by years of neglect. 
@EnvAgency @CanalRiverTrust we must all play our part #cleantheharp https://t.co/eYHE85T20g

Need accurate & honest information on @RiverChess sewage discharges, without this @EnvAgency will never solve these issues. Hope you are listening @JamesBevanEA you still owe the Public Account  Committee a correction to your correction about sewage discharges into Chalkstreams.

@PJennings88 @RiverChess @EnvAgency Local council collected samples from pipe discharging onto our land.  Recorded dry weather for some samples (didn't rain on the day/day before).  They had no understanding of the volume of groundwater entering the pipe/sewage chambers and the dilution effect (we live on a hill)üôÑ

tweets.text: Mattresses. Sofas. Duvets. Industrial fridges. Bags and bags of plastic. From the River Crane. Decided to take action after authorities failed the environment. @FriendsRivCrane @GuyLambert @CVP_CraneValley @CanLager @HestonActionG @CanalRiverTrust @EnvAgency @LlangattockPick https://t.co/loCt8HiweY

I expect we will get into a protracted discussion with the @EnvAgency over what causes theses sewage discharges on the @RiverChess, they know the problem and I know the problem is so lets hope they do not waste my time or insult my intelligence with their usual arguments.

Thank you to those who called us about an oil pollution on the River Dove near #Ashbourne #Derbyshire

We're working to locate the source & to minimise the impact on the #environment

If you have any information about this or to report any environmental incidents call 0800 807060 https://t.co/QLj8iBZx3H
If 1000‚Äôs of people took a shit each day directly into a river there would be uproar. Call it a CSO and @EnvAgency do fuck all. @EnvAgencyYNE https://t.co/kLk1JhTSc1

domain.name: TV Shows

entity.name: Countryfile
entity.description: Stories are shared of the people, places and issues at the heart of the British countryside. Popular features include the programme's photography contest, which culminates in a yearly calendar sold to benefit charity, the Video Diary, produced by viewers and focused on life in rural areas, and the weather forecasts.

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Countryfile Diaries
entity.description: A sister show to the BBC's `Countryfile' series, this rural affairs programme sees a team of presenters travel the length and breadth of the United Kingdom to cover stories related to the British countryside and the season of spring. As this period is a busy time of the year for the farming and outdoor communities in particular, regular topics covered include the production of food, nature conservation, and a look at a chosen area's culture and history. Stunning landscapes and a variety of wildlife also feature prominently.
